page.title: 15MENDIP HOSPITAL 1
page.content: The hospital was built at a time when large mental institutions were seen as a means of removing people suffering mental illness from the community, to a place where they could be confined, if not cured. "Mendip", as it is locally known, stands on the N.E. edge of Wells in extensive grounds, which with Victorian thoroughness, were used to grow vegetables and raise animals, thus providing a healthy diet and therapeutic exercise. The total area of "Mendip" covers{300 acres}and was purchased for{Â£35}in the middle of the l9th century. The hospital's early history was focused on the treatment of local people who worked in the{lead mining {industry}and suffered from the effects of heavy metal poisoning. This role declined along with the industry.
